3: Confidentiality Level: A+, Urgency: S, Hazard Index: A+, Authentication: Gray Raven. Mission details uploaded. Implementing the permission request...
Commandant, a new request for combat has come in from Babylonia.
It's different from our typical missions this time... Commandant, do you know anything about the 'Memory Chip'?
As you know, the Memory Chip is the culmination of extraordinary tactical memory data of human ancestors.
As the commandant, you can equip and combine various Memory Chips for the Construct through the tactical support program to design a tactical plan.
In this way, the Construct can make use of different tactical memory data to better deal with the changes during battles.
Your answer makes me wonder if we've been in a state of vacancy in the six memory slots.
... Am I supposed to feel relieved now? All in all, the Memory Chip is the culmination of the extraordinary tactical memory data of our human ancestors.
It's something to think about whether it's the amazing luck or the inconspicuous leadership of the commandant that has gotten the Gray Raven this far.
As the commandant, you can equip and combine various Memory Chips for the Construct through the tactical support program to design a tactical plan.
In this way, the Construct can make use of different tactical memory data to better deal with the changes during battles.
The Memory Chip tech has always been a significant and effective approach to enhance the overall battle power of Constructs.
But now, it was intercepted by the Ascendants.
The tactical terminal of Babylonia was recently infected by the Punishing Virus and it tore a tiny gap.
The gap is extremely small. Records show that a central system has found and fixed this tiny gap in 0.03 seconds. But the gap... happens to be where the memory data is stored.
This was a well-planned and targeted attack, most likely initiated by the Ascendants.
Though we've isolated the memory data that was briefly exposed, only 27.7% of the memory data is guaranteed to be uncorrupted after a thorough check.
Yes, Commandant.
Fortunately, Memory Chip tech is a core tech that has been put into research since the end of the Post-Pandemic Age.
All original data of uncorrupted memory should still be preserved in the ground tactical initially deployed on Earth.
There's still hope. Don't panic.
Yes, Commandant. But according to the analysis of the early related records, Babylonia has acquired an important message.
At the end of the Post-Pandemic Age, humans once deployed a ground tactical terminal on Earth, where it was highly likely to preserve all uncorrupted original memory data.
That's right.

2: Are you sure it was not corrupted?
4: Do the ascendants have any idea about this?

3: I'm not a hundred percent sure. After all, the records were too far back and a lot of information was lacking, but it's worth looking into.
I'm not a hundred percent sure. But even if it's a risky move, it's also the only effective way to recycle the original uncorrupted memory data in the ground tactical terminal.
Combat mission confirmed: Detect the original memory data in the ground tactical terminal and recycle the uncorrupted data to restore functionality.
Liv, have you located where the ground tactical terminal is?
Commandant, I've detected ten ground tactical terminals through data analysis and calculations.
The positioning satellite detected that there was a strong reaction of the Corrupted everywhere, but no signs of the Ascendants...
We have to recycle all memory data before they discover the ground tactical terminals.
The information and corruption analysis report of the ten Memory Chips have already been loaded into my database.
